name.gco:CharacterString: Data Stewardship Maturity Matrix Maturity Scales for Key Components

scope.gco:CharacterString: Codelists for description of "datastewardship assessment results" ... compliant with ISO/TC 211 19115:2003 and 19139

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data is not preserved. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Preservability Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Ad Hoc. Not Managed. Any storage location. Data only. Level 1.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Preservability Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Minimal. Managed Limited. Non-designated repository. Redundancy . Limited archiving metadata. Level 2.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Preservability Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Intermediate. Managed. Defined, partially implemented. Designated archive. Redundancy. Community-standard archiving metadata. Conforming to limited archiving standards.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Preservability
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Advanced. Managed. Well-Defined, Fully Implemented. Level 3 +. Conforming to community archiving standards.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Preservability Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Optimal. Level 4 +. Measured , Controlled , Audit. Level 4 +. Archiving process performance controlled, measured, and audited. Future archiving standard changes planned.

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of being searchable and accessible publicly

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data is not accessed. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Accessibility Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Not publicly available Person-to-person

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Accessibility Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Publicly available Direct file download (e.g., via anonymous FTP server) Collection/dataset level searchable online

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Accessibility Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 2 + Non-standard data service Limited data server performance Granule/file level searchable Limited search metrics

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Accessibility Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 3 + Community-standard data service Enhanced data server performance Conforming to community search metrics Dissemination report metrics defined and implemented internally

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Accessibility Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + Dissemination reports available online Future technology and standard changes planned

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of being easy to use.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data is not used. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Usability Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Extensive product-specific knowledge required No documentation online

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Usability Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Non-standard data format Limited documentation (e.g., userâ€™s guide) online

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Usability Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Community standard-based interoperable format and metadata Documentation (e.g., source code, product algorithm document, processing or/and data flow diagram) online

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Usability Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 3 + Basic capability (e.g., subsetting, aggregating) and data characterization (overall/global, e.g., climatology, error estimates) available online

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Usability Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + Enhanced online capability (e.g., visualization, multiple data formats) Community metrics of data characterization (regional/cell) online External ranking

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of data production being sustainable and extendable.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data is not sustainable in production. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Production Sustainability Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Ad Hoc or Not applicable. No obligation or deliverable requirement.

codeEntry.CodeDefinition: Production Sustainability Level 2 Short-term Individual PIâ€™s commitment (grant obligations). minimal`

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Production Sustainability Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Medium-term Institutional commitment (contractual deliverables with specs and schedule defined).

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Production Sustainability Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Long-term Institutional commitment. Product improvement process in place.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Production Sustainability Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + National or international commitment. Changes for technology planned.

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of data quality being assured.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data quality is not assured. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assurance Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Data quality assurance (DQA) procedure unknown or none.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assurance Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Ad Hoc and random DQA procedure not defined and documented.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assurance Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: DQA procedure defined and documented and partially implemented.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assurance Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: DQA procedure well documented, fully implemented and available online with master reference data Limited data quality assurance metadata.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assurance Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + DQA procedure monitored and reported Conforming to community quality metadata and standards External review.

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of data quality being controlled and monitored.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data quality control is not monitored. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Control Monitoring Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: None or Sampling unknown or spotty Analysis unknown or random in time.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Control Monitoring Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Sampling and analysis are regular in time and space Limited product-specific metrics defined and implemented

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Control Monitoring Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 2+ Sampling and analysis are frequent and systematic but not automatic Community metrics defined and partially implemented Procedure documented and available online

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Control Monitoring Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 3 + Anomaly detection procedure well-documented and fully implemented using community metrics, automatic, tracked and reported Limited quality monitoring metadata

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Control Monitoring Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + Cross-validation of temporal and spatial characteristics Physical consistency check Conforming to community quality metadata and standards Dynamic providers/users feedback in place

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of data quality being assessed.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data quality is not assessed. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assessment Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Algorithm/method/model theoretical basis assessed (methods and results online)

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assessment Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 1 + Research product assessed (methods and results online)

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assessment Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 2 + Operational product assessed (methods and results online)

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assessment Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 3 + Operational product assessed (methods and results online)

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Quality Assessment Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + Operational product assessed (methods and results online)

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of being transparent, trackable, and traceable.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Transparency and Traceability is not assessed. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transparency Traceability Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Limited product information available. Person-to-person.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transparency Traceability Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Product information available in literature.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transparency Traceability Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document (ATBD) and source code online Dataset configuration managed (CM) Unique Object Identifier (OID) assigned (dataset, documentation, source code) Data citation tracked (e.g., utilizing Digital Object Identifier (DOI) system).

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transparency Traceability Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 3 + Operational Algorithm Description (OAD) online, OID assigned, and under CM.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transparency Traceability Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + System information online Complete data provenance online.

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: The state of data integrity being verifiable.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Assessment not performed. Level 0.
Data Integrity is not assessed. Level 0.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Integrity Level 1
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Unknown or no data ingest integrity check.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Integrity Level 2
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Data ingest integrity verifiable (e.g., checksum technology).

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Integrity Level 3
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 2 + Data archive integrity verifiable.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Integrity Level 4
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 3 + Data access integrity verifiable Conforming to community data integrity technology standard.

CodeDefinition.gml:name: Data Integrity Level 5
CodeDefinition.gml:description: Level 4 + Data authenticity verifiable (e.g., data signature technology) Performance of data integrity check monitored and reported.
